item.title: Wizards of the Coast Drops Secret Lair: Rad Superdrop, Bringing More Fallout to the Iconic Card Game
item.content:encoded:
Wizards of the Coast has announced a new Secret Lair superdrop for Magic: The Gathering. The new Secret Lair: Rad Superdrop brings in more cards from Bethesda's post-apocalyptic sci-fi franchise, Fallout.

The Magic: The Gathering Secret Lair: Rad Superdrop Announcement

In an official announcement post, Wizards of the Coast detailed four drops of cards as part of the Secret Lair: Rad Superdrop. These four drops will focus on different elements and facets of the Fallout series.

The first drop, Secret Lair x Fallout: Beyond Vault 33, focuses entirely on the Fallout TV Show on Prime Video. This drop will contain six cards. Three of these cards are original designs featuring the show's leads: Lucy, The Ghoul, and Maximus. The other three are equipment cards, Pre-War Formalwear, Spirit Mantle, and T-45 Power Armor reimagined as T-60 Power Armor.

Notably, this drop is the first Secret Lair made available on Amazon. This is most likely an extension of marketing for the show's second season.

For dog lovers, the Secret Lair x Fallout: Greet The Dog drop is for you. This drop contains five cards, featuring artwork of the most loyal pup in the post-apocalyptic wasteland. The drop contains the following:

  • Yoshimaru, Ever Faithful as "Dogmeat, Constant Companion"
  • Arcane Signet
  • Lightning Greaves
  • Patchwork Banner
  • Sol Ring

The third drop in the Secret Lair: Rad Superdrop is aptly titled Secret Lair x Fallout: Rad. This drop of cards focuses on the more outlandish sci-fi elements of the series. This includes the Nightkin Supermutants, Fallout 76's Mothman, and the bizarre mutations brought on by wasteland radiation. The cards contained are as follows:

  • Ripples of Potential
  • Mutational Advantage
  • The Wise Mothman
  • Mindcrank
  • Mesmeric Orb as "Mothman Egg"

Lastly, drop number four spotlights the fan-favorite Fallout: New Vegas. The drop, Secret Lair x Fallout: Welcome to New Vegas, is more standard fare. Older Magic: The Gathering cards featuring Fallout-themed artwork and card names. Humorously enough, one of those repurposed cards comes from the official Dungeons & Dragons set, Adventures in the Forgotten Realms. The five cards included are as follows:

  • Tinybones, Trinket Thief as "Benny, Platinum Thief"
  • Isshin, Two Heavens as One as "Joshua Graham, Burned Man"
  • The Deck of Many Things as "Custom Caravan Deck"
  • Caged Sun as "The Platinum Chip"
  • Nuka-Cola Vending Machine as "Sunset Sasparilla Machine"

Pre-orders for the Secret Lair: Rad Superdrop will go live on January 26, 2026. Beyond Vault 33 is available in non-foil at an MSRP of $39.99 and foil at an MSRP of $49.99. The other drops are available in non-foil at an MSRP of $29.99 and foil at an MSRP of $39.99. For those with deep pockets, any purchase above $149 will get a Silver Shroud Costume promo card at no additional cost while supplies last.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. Thisâ€¦ More about Tyler
